message: But I notice a lot of people posting links to Instagram
that and dalton caldwell is a badass
i was hooked after his startup school speech
maybe they think browsers are dead
I think Instagram has a better iPhone app, but Picplz wins on the web interface. I use Instagram.
What do you guys think, do you check what super power you give apps over your data?
main reason
I noticed @Stammy uses picplz
I've got android, so I can't really use Instagram
Just wondering if accessing my contact data is really required to post a photo. It always makes me nervous to accept this from an app.
@ericflo I used to do the same but I start to question this. I realized I'm leaking not only my personnal data but also my contact one. It's evil :(
Which one do you use, and why?
I like picplz b/c it has a web interface. ppl can see my past images easily. instagram doesnt do that
http://picplz.com/user/stammy/
I admit it's a little weird that instagram doesn't have a website really at all
@bminde Wow, that's interesting then.  Mobile experience matters more than web, for this instance.
I use Instagram and Path.  Never heard of picplz.  Path is nice and has a nice web ui but commenting is tied to txt messaging which I'm not too fond of.
@davidpaccoud I always just say "yes" without thinking...it's terrible.

@ericflo Yes, I mostly use it to share with other Instagram users, so then the iPhone app is most important. But lately I've been using Path more and more to only share with my closest friends. I think that the path app is even better than Instagram, and the web interface is ok.
Instagram, slicker iPhone app. I think they're currently working on a major revision of the web interface and Android.
@ericflo Instagram. They are working on a web interface which I believe will be very badass. Hoping for them to do something unique here. They do need an Android app though.
@courtstarr That's awesome!  Agreed on android--that's what prevents me from using it.
@courtstarr  @ericflo 'analysts' reckon they are the last big app to launch iPhone only.
instagram has better filters
I am hating on Instagram for not thinking of us Android users but really I'm just jealous iPhoners have it before we do :) I'll switch over from PicPlz as soon as Instagram launches for Android.
This totally cool guy I know was interviewed about Instagram: http://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/20/technology/personaltech/20basics.html
But @stammy got me started on picplz and I really like that as well.
